item.title: Blizzard Is Hiring for an Unannounced Open World Shooter
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/blizzard-is-hiring-for-an-unannounced-open-world-shooter/

As spotted by ResetEra's Uzupedro, Blizzard Entertainment is currently hiring personnel for an unannounced open world shooter game. The job is for an Associate Design Director of Innovation.

At Blizzard, we craft genre-defining games and legendary worlds for all to share. Through unparalleled creativity and storytelling, we create immersive universes and iconic characters that are beloved across platforms, borders, backgrounds, and generations - only made possible by building a work environment that nurtures the artistry of game development and unleashes the aspirations of our people.

As the Design Director of Innovation, you will be the vision holder and owner of key strategic innovations on an upcoming open-world shooter game. You stay current with the latest developments in both the indie and AAA space. David Bowie is quoted as saying, “Go a little bit out of your depth. And when you don’t feel that your feet are quite touching the bottom, you’re just about in the right place to do something exciting”–the idea of innovating in the deep end excites you, balanced with a pragmatic desire to turn dreams into reality that players can get their hands on and enjoy. This role is anticipated to be a hybrid work position, with some work on-site and some work-from-home. The home studio for this position is Irvine, CA.

This isn't the first time Blizzard has attempted the creation of an open world shooter. I'm referring to project Titan, of course. The game should have been an MMO shooter, but after seven years of development, the studio was forced to cancel it. Some of its remnants were turned into Overwatch, which is, however, a session-based game.

More recently, Blizzard canceled another its survival game codenamed Odyssey. Perhaps it would be more accurate to say that Microsoft canceled it, though. Anyway, the game reportedly suffered from a troubled development phase. Let's hope the same thing won't happen with this new open world shooter.

item.title: Avowed Is Now Available for Pre-Order, Day One Game Pass Release
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/avowed-is-now-available-for-pre-order-day-one-game-pass-release/

Avowed, the upcoming RPG from Obsidian Entertainment and Xbox Game Studios, is officially available for pre-order. If you are looking forward to playing Avowed, the game will be available on February 18, 2025, on Xbox Series X|S, Xbox app on Windows, Battle.net, and Steam. Alternatively, Avowed will be available to play on day one with Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass. In a blog post on Xbox Wire, you can now read about the upcoming release of Avowed, as well as the PC specs that you'll need to have to be able to play it, which have been posted on Steam.

Minimum:

    • OS: Windows 10/11 with updates
    • Processor: AMD Ryzen 5 2600 / Intel i5-8400
    • Memory: 16 GB RAM
    • Graphics: AMD RX 5700 / Nvidia GTX 1070 / Intel Arc A580
    • DirectX: Version 12
    • Storage: 75 GB available space

Recommended:

    • OS: Windows 10/11 with updates
    • Processor: AMD Ryzen 5 5600X / Intel i7-10700K
    • Memory: 16 GB RAM
    • Graphics: Graphics: AMD RX 6800 XT / Nvidia RTX 3080
    • DirectX: Version 12
    • Storage: 75 GB available space

As a reminder, the game will support NVIDIA DLSS 3 and ray tracing effects on PC.

If you're looking to pre-order Avowed, there are three different editions to choose from, with the more expensive editions providing you with exclusive in-game rewards that you wouldn't be able to get otherwise. You will be able to purchase the Avowed Digital Standard Edition, which costs $69.99 and includes the Base Game only. Alternatively, there's the Avowed Digital Premium Edition, which costs $89.99 and comes with up to five days of Early Access, two Premium Skin Packs, and access to the Digital Artbook and Soundtrack.

Finally, suppose you feel like this game is a worthy investment. In that case, you can purchase the Avowed Premium Edition Steelbook for a hefty $95.99, which comes with a Digital Code for the game, up to five days of Early Access, two Premium Skin Packs, access to the Digital Artbook and Soundtrack, an Avowed SteelBook and a map of the Living Lands. Depending on where you prefer to read your information, the Xbox Wire blog post and the Blizzard blog post list more details about the game's accessibility features and what is included in the Premium Skin packs.

To try and make the game as accessible and easy to use as possible, players will be able to play the game via Game Pass Ultimate or PC Game Pass, as well as link their Xbox and Battle.net accounts to play Avowed via Battle.net if they prefer that client to the Xbox one.
